sn4.5:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn4.5:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn4.5:5.1: “Mendicants, I am freed from all snares, both human and divine.
sn4.5:5.2: You are also freed from all snares, both human and divine.
sn4.5:5.3: Wander forth, mendicants, for the welfare and happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
sn4.5:5.4: Let not two go by one road.
sn4.5:5.5: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And explain a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.
sn4.5:5.6: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.
sn4.5:5.7: There will be those who understand the teaching!
sn4.5:5.8: I will travel to Uruvelā, the village of Senāni, in order to teach the Dhamma.”
sn4.5:5.9: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.5:6.3: You’re bound by the great bond:
sn4.5:7.3: I’m freed from the great bonds;
